clinical_study.brief_title: Relevance of the Activ'Dos App for Chronic Low Back Pain Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Relevance of the Activ'Dos App for Chronic Low Back Pain Patients - Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare a self rehabilitation program using ACTIV'DOS app versus using a standard sheet of paper.

detailed_description.textblock: This study involves patients with chronic low back pain. The purpose of this study is to compare a self-rehabilitation program using ACTIV'DOS app versus a standard sheet of paper. Disabilities are measured with a Roland-Morris questionnaire.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: There are 2 groups : an interventional group with ACTIV'DOS app ; and a control group with a standard procedure using a sheet of paper.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from functional impairment with Roland-Morris questionnaire at 6 weeks.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (patient inclusion) and Day 42 (end of patient monitoring)
primary_outcome.description: Disabilities are measured with Roland-Morris questionnaire, from Day 0 to Day 42. This questionnaire includes 24 items with 1 point per item. The score ranges from 0 (no disability) to 24 (max. disability).

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference of average pain during the seven last days with VAS pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (patient inclusion) and Day 42 (end of patient monitoring)
secondary_outcome.description: VAS pain is a scale measuring pain intensity from 0 (no pain) to 10 (extreme pain). For this outcome, the average pain during the seven last days is evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference of worse pain during the seven last days with VAS pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (patient inclusion) and Day 42 (end of patient monitoring)
secondary_outcome.description: VAS pain is a scale measuring pain intensity from 0 (no pain) to 10 (extreme pain). For this outcome, the worse pain during the seven last days is evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compliance (number of sessions done over the number of recommanded sessions) of self-rehabilitation program at 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Compliance is evaluated with a compliance table. Patients have to complete this table after each session. Investigators will report the compliance table at the end of the patient monitoring (Week 6).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of satisfaction with Likert scale
secondary_outcome.description: Likert scale is a scale with 10 questions. For each question, the scale ranges from 3 (strongly agree) to -3 (strongly disagree).

arm_group.description: ACTIV'DOS is a smartphone application of self rehabilitation. There are 7 muscular exercices. Patients going to exercices during 15 minutes per day, during 6 weeks.

This group uses a sheet of paper for self-rehabilitation exercise. The self-rehabilitation program is the same as the ACTIV'DOS group. Patients have to exercise during 15 minutes per day, during 6 weeks.

intervention.description: ACTIV'DOS group use ACTIV'DOS application (with smartphone) to do the self rehabilitation each day (15 minutes per day) during 6 weeks. There are 7 exercices.
Control group uses a standard sheet of paper to do the self-rehabilitation (15 minutes per day) during 6 weeks. There are 7 exercises.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- chronic low back pain for more than 3 months
- Aged to 18 or more
- Possibility to use Activ'dos application with smartphone or tablet
- Initial score of Roland Morris questionnaire >= 4
- Fit to consent
- Who has signed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any signs of severe illness underlying to radicular and lumbar pain like red flags
- Guardianship or protection of vulnerable adult
- Pregnant or nursing
- Refuse to participate
